title: Instructional Design for Concrete Understanding of Vector Addition: Application of the Concrete-to-Abstract Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic algebraic operations and geometric shapes
context.additional_context: A blended approach combining in-person instruction with online activities, focusing on gradual abstraction of vector concepts through team-based tasks and individual analysis of real-world application cases

learning_goals: Learners accurately convert vectors into graphical and algebraic representations in diverse physical contexts (e.g., force, motion).
Learners can perform vector addition by progressing through the stages of concrete objects (model arrows) → semi-concrete objects (digital vector tools) → abstract symbols (coordinate notation).
Learners can explain vector operations by connecting their geometric meaning (e.g., parallelogram law) with algebraic representations (component-wise calculations).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
